intro: Acroglyphe runcinata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acroglyphe, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, pointed lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by dark berries as its fruit. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
